holidays.name: World Toilet Day 🚽
holidays.description: A day to raise awareness of the global sanitation crisis and inspire action to tackle the issues around access to toilets and clean sanitation.
holidays.origin: Established by the United Nations in 2013 to highlight the importance of sanitation and hygiene worldwide.
holidays.funFact: Did you know 4.2 billion people globally still lack access to safely managed sanitation services? This day flushes that issue into the spotlight!

holidays.name: International Men's Day 👨
holidays.description: A day to celebrate men and boys, focusing on men's health, gender equality, and positive male role models.
holidays.origin: Started in 1992 by Dr. Jerome Teelucksingh in Trinidad and Tobago to highlight the positive contributions of men in society and challenge stereotypes.
holidays.funFact: International Men's Day has six key themes, from promoting positive role models to improving gender relations and men's health awareness.

holidays.name: Peanut Butter Fudge Day 🍬🥜
holidays.description: A sweet celebration honoring the rich, creamy, nutty delight of peanut butter fudge.
holidays.origin: An unofficial food holiday started by peanut butter lovers and fudge aficionados to celebrate this delicious treat.
holidays.funFact: Peanut butter fudge dates back to early 1900s confectionery recipes and combines two classic favorites—peanut butter and rich fudge—into one addictive dessert!

holidays.name: National Play Monopoly Day 🎲💰
holidays.description: Celebrate the classic board game Monopoly by gathering friends or family for some real estate rivalry and fun!
holidays.origin: An unofficial day dedicated to the iconic board game first patented in 1935, recognizing its place in pop culture and family entertainment.
holidays.funFact: The longest game of Monopoly ever played lasted 70 straight days — talk about being trapped on Boardwalk!
